descriptionSet.description: In this Image in a sample calendar poster of Empire Calender Manufacturing Co., Calcutta., Lord Vishnu can be seen in the centre with several stories from the religious stories of Satyanarain depicted around him. There is a woman on the right corner seen performing the Satyanarain puja. On the top right of the image, a couple can be seen looking towards a fleet of ships sailing on the sea. On the left an old man dressed in white robes and a cap and holding a vessel and stick can be seen blessing a bald man wearing a sacred thread across his body. The same old man can be seen on the bottom left sitting below a tree and looking towards a fleet of ships. A richly dressed man is standing across the river from the old man. The title translates from Hindi as "the stories of Satyanarain"

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: In this Image in a sample calendar poster of Empire Calender Manufacturing Co., Calcutta., Lord Vishnu can be seen in the centre with several stories from the religious stories of Satyanarain depicted around him. There is a woman on the right corner seen performing the Satyanarain puja. On the top right of the image, a couple can be seen looking towards a fleet of ships sailing on the sea. On the left an old man dressed in white robes and a cap and holding a vessel and stick can be seen blessing a bald man wearing a sacred thread across his body. The same old man can be seen on the bottom left sitting below a tree and looking towards a fleet of ships. A richly dressed man is standing across the river from the old man. The title translates from Hindi as "the stories of Satyanarain" (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Satyanarain is the form of Vishnu considered to be the embodiment of truth. The stories of Satyanarain are meant to teach people to remember God's grace when their wishes are granted. Sri Satyanarayan Vrat (fast) and puja (prayer) are supposed to be the path to get all your wishes granted by God and reach your goals. It is supposed to have been narrated to the sage Narada by Lord Vishnu when the sage asked him for a solution for all the ills of the world.() (sp)
